<small>Also see: **<big>[[H7927|שְׁכֶם]]</big>**</small>

 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁכֶם‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Zeph.3.9|Zeph 3:9]]</sup> ==shoulder==; — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> [[Gen.48.2|Gen 48:2]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁכֶ֑ם‎</span> [[Gen.33.19|Gen 33:19]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֶׁ֑כֶם‎</span> [[Ps.21.13|Ps 21:13]] (whence original \****šakm*** inferred [[BDB#Ol|Ol]]<sup>§ 147 a near the end</sup> [[BDB#Sta|Sta]]<sup>§ 199 a</sup>; but <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ֶ֯‎</span> derived from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ִ֯‎</span> before <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כ‎</span>, [[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>NB 104</sup> [[BDB#Kö|Kö]] ii.l.67, 506); construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁכֶם‎</span> [[Gen.9.23|Gen 9:23]] suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁכְמוֺ‎</span> [[Gen.49.15|Gen 49:15]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁכְמָה‎</span> (for <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁכְמָהּ‎</span> [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:91e»§ 91e</sup>) [[Job.31.22|Job 31:22]], etc.; — 

**1.** ***shoulder*** (sometimes including back of neck; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כתף‎</span> = ***shoulder-blade***): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as bearing burdens, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִסְבֹּל‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיֵּט שׁ‎</span> [[Gen.49.15|Gen 49:15]] (poem in [[BDB#J|J]]; Issachar under figure of ass), compare [[Gen.21.14|Gen 21:14]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Gen.24.15|Gen 24:15]]; [[Gen.24.45|Gen 24:45]]; [[Exod.12.34|Exod 12:34]], also [[Gen.9.23|Gen 9:23]] (all [[BDB#J|J]]), [[Josh.4.5|Josh 4:5]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Judg.9.48|Judg 9:48]]; [[Isa.10.27|Isa 10:27]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צַוָּאר‎</span>), [[Isa.14.25|Isa 14:25]] (both figurative), [[Ps.81.7|Ps 81:7]], so, metaphorical, of responsibility of rule [[Isa.9.5|Isa 9:5]]; [[Isa.22.22|Isa 22:22]]= (symbolized by key), of accusation as (easy) burden [[Job.31.36|Job 31:36]] figurative also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶחָד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְעָבְדוֺ שׁ‎</span> [[Zeph.3.9|Zeph 3:9]] ***to serve him*** (with) ***one shoulder*** (as one man), of. Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** in statement of Saul's height, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִשִּׁכְמוֺ וָמַ֫עְלָה גָּכֹהַּ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִכָּלהָֿעָם‎</span>[[1Sam.9.2|1Sam 9:2]], compare [[1Sam.10.23|1Sam 10:23]] and (with play on proper name, of a location <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁכֶם‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַהַד עַלאַֿחֶיךָ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָתַתִּי לְךָ שׁ‎</span> [[Gen.48.22|Gen 48:22]] ([[BDB#E|E]]; compare [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]). 

**2.** in general ***back:*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּהַפְנֹתוֺ שִׁכְמוֺ לָלֶכֶת מֵעִם‎</span> [[1Sam.10.9|1Sam 10:9]] so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּשִׁיתֵמוֺ שׁ‎</span> [[Ps.21.13|Ps 21:13]], i.e. make them turn (in flight; compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאוֺיְבַי נָתַתָּה לִי עֹרֶף‎</span>, [[Ps.18.41|Ps 18:41]]); as beaten <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַטֵּה שׁ‎</span> [[Isa.9.3|Isa 9:3]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁבֶט הַנֹּנֵשׂ בּוֺ‎</span>); more anatomical <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִפּוֺל‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּתֵפִי מִשּׁ‎</span> [[Job.31.22|Job 31:22]] ***let my shoulder blade fall from its back***. — [[Hos.6.9|Hos 6:9]] see II.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁכֶם‎</span> below 

<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁכְמָה‎</span> see foregoing.
